intro: Rhachidosorus, commonly known as the feather fern, is a genus of ferns belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, feathery fronds that are often divided into numerous small, narrow segments. These fronds are typically arching or drooping, giving the plant a graceful appearance. Rhachidosorus species are often found in moist, shaded environments, such as forests or rocky crevices. The genus includes several species, many of which are prized for their ornamental value in horticulture.
